title: @Riot you nerf devouer and fail to relaise that guinsoo is the problem...
body:
Seriously... this items has been a pain in the ass since you reworked it... just nerf it and it'll be good. Like... make it only stack on champions...

Edit: "realized" instead of "realised", my bad.

It was reworked pretty heavily and has a been a pain in the ass ever since.

May I suggest getting rid of the AoE for Ranged champions (as a starting point) seeing as the AoE from Titanic and Ravenous Hydra can't be applied on Ranged Basic Attacks.

Aside from that, my main issue with Rageblade is its gold efficiency. It's cheap as hell. 2800g to 3300g would be a more reasonable cost.

Excuse me for interrupting but this seemed worth of a comment, so here I am. 

Why do you think is a problem on ranged champions? Honest question. 
It already takes twice as long to stack on ranged champions and they aren't even really favored or broken with rageblade right now.
I am thinking of Kayle specifically. She was strong with release sated devourer but that got nerfed pretty quickly and rageblade makes her kinda 'OK' right now. And Kog'maw was pretty much ignored before patch 6.3. Then he became an absolute monster with the buffs from 6.3 and stopped skilling Q altogether. I am not sure if I completely understand the correlation between heavy buffs making Kog'Maw super strong and Rageblade being at fault for this.

Because they get Runaan's which means that, after the initial half rate of stacking that Ranged Champions have with the item, they're stacking up Rageblade ~33% faster than melee champions.

Kayle is an exception and, honestly, her Auto-Attacks with E should just be considered to be Melee in the first place. It's not like they're missiles that a Yasuo or Braum could block anyway.
Runaan's doesn't stack rageblade any faster, it does stack Fervor of Battle, but that's not really relevant here.

Sated Devourer's attack counter and empowered effect both occur on-attack, not on-hit. The item will not interact with abilities that apply on-hit effects (e.g.  Ravage, Mystic Shot, Infinite Infinite Duress).

Additionally, effects that cause you to attack more than once will only be counted once (i.e.  Ranger's Focus, Double Strike and Lightslinger) - you cannot increase the frequency that Phantom Hit will occur.


Bolts generated by  Runaan's Hurricane even when hitting 2 additional targets will still count only as 1 attack towards trigering Phantom Hit.

-Excerpt found on the League of Legends Wiki page 
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Sated_Devourer



This is my thinking on Guinsoo's 4 hits for melee champs. I don't like it, but it makes sense. Why? Because melee champs have to get right in the middle of the fight. A COMPETANT team will CC you and then stomp you, this is just assuming you picked a team with any hard CC.

it doesn't stack up faster with hurricane.
What hurricane does is applying the aoe on-hit on 3 targets, and if they are close together this means each one will take the on-hit 3 times
That change actually makes sense. Reduces its extraneous power as a potential pushing weapon, and makes it only suited for teamfights.

When you stack it up the on hit gives too much raw power combined with overall stats given by the item. So basicly you get AS, AD, AP plus an AOE on hit magic dmg scaling with your ad and ap that allows you to kill basicly everything in your way.
Key word "when" with Devourer nerfs it's gunna be impossible for Devourer junglers to be played in high elo's.
High elo already all agree Devourer junglers are _already_ crap. Why would you spend almost 20 minutes farming when early game champs can win the game in that time?

That's the thing though, I did a quick look and just building Rageblade vs building idk, Ravenous Hydra, Hydra actually gives more raw damage, the only advantage for Rageblade is it's stacking attack speed.  This is why I ask questions, because I just don't see what people are saying.

rageblade cost 700 less than hydra, and with full stacks it grants 54 ad, while also giving 72 ap which some champs like jax can use aswell, **while giving 64% AS**. A stacked up guinsoo's is the highest AS item in the game, while also giving alot ad and ap, and the ~40-50 magic aoe on-hit are quite nice on top.
thx to the multiplicative nature of ad/on-hit and as, guinsoo's offers insane dps for AA champs as it offers both, huge as, good ad and a good on-hit, and for those with proper scaleings even ap.

Especially in a splitpush where you can stack rageblade befor engageing on an champion, it gives way superior dps compared to any other item while also beeing on the cheap side.
However, it's horrible builtpath makes it a risky item as you set yourself behind alot tuill it's comnplete, and it's not that strong in teamfights as it needs to stack up and constant attacking to be worth it, which especially as melee is rather hard to do.
Therfor OPs suggsetion is prett good as it takes some of the exesive splitpush power it has without hurting the teamfighting.

The AS seems to be where all of it's power is packed.

If you were to rush {{item:3124}} all it's own, the on hit would only amount to 33.5 damage.

Meanwhile {{item:3074}} would deal between 23-69 damage to all targets depending on their range.
Then there's {{item:3748}} which adds 9.676 damage to your auto attack while hitting enemies behind for 51.69
(Note, I calculated the two hydras based on lowest AD/Health) 

If Guinsoo's were to need a nerf, I expect the AS would be where it would have to be hit.  Granted, it doesn't sound like it's TOO extreme a case.  We just have a typical case of on hit items being good with on hit champs, and on hit champs being annoyingly good whenever they are able to reach a power stage.

(Side note: Makes me wonder what would happen if I did {{champion:54}} {{item:3931}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3074}} )

i think the AS is the exact wrong spot to hit it, as that's it's selling point.
I think OPs idea of makeing it stack vs champs only would already solve the problem, and else i'd rather nerf the ad, cause if you want ad there are better options, while for as **without crit**, you have nearly no options.

(Side note: You would most likely explode as soon as the ult cc wears off due to haveing no defense at all)

Hm, maybe.  Good clear speed items aren't all over the place.  Aside from Hydra, Rageblade is about the only other AoE waveclear option for auto attackers.  I'd have to see how it would handle with the change.  

(Side note: Still thinking of trying it in a custom tonight if I can, and with two slots for defensive items alongside defensive boots, late game could be an unstoppable beast.)

Confirming she is insanely strong with both. She farms incredibly fast which pretty much guarantees she gets sated in 15-20 minutes. At worst she just gets delayed a few minutes and still builds Guinsoo's. Throw in some speed boots and Titanic Hydra and watch the rift burn. Double kill, triple kill, quadra kill, almost had a penta in one game. RWEQ on a carry and they just explode.

Hasn't Shyvana always been a good farmer in the jungle due to her burnout and on hit?  I think her only major problem has always been a lack of good CC and being easily kited once her burnout runs out.

The issue with rageblade is that it is meant to be a hybrid item but suits ad on-hit champions. They should change it by reducing the AD, increasing the AP and changing the on-hit to have a lower base and higher AP ratio. Then it will be a hybrid item.

Or they could make melee champions not get 2 stacks when they atack.Melee champions are the ones abusing this item because they only need 4 atacks to get it's full effectivement.Just remove this 2 stacks for melee feature,there's no point in keeping it.

Both are problems. Devourer needs to be tuned to be a late mid to early late game item. Junglers are getting sated in 15 minutes pretty easy right now. Sated should pretty much never be reached before 20 minutes for it to be balanced.

First off both are a problem. Devourer was overbuffed when rift herald was released and they nerfed it to reflect that change.

Rageblade-wise all they need to do is raise rageblade price to 3.1k, add recurve bow to the recipe, Move the base stats on rageblade to the passive and remove melee attack double stacking.

Rageblade is only a problem in my opinion on a few champions. Yi and Xin are on the top of my list. Basically they can be insane on any Madc who is high autoattack / just autoattack focused. 

Much like sated devourer there is not a counter to its substantial damage increase. I would love to test it with someone, but I do not believe Thornmail reflects the damage from either of these bonuses.....

honestly rageblade is pretty strong but it wasnt a huge problem until certain champs got a little too over tuned or got some crazy synergy off of an item(s) i.e. {{champion:5}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:96}} but other than that its not so crazy strong that it should be nerfed just its abusers should and this devourer nerf is pretty misguided and i dont want to see another item get nerfed because it has ezreal syndrome where the item gets blamed when its clearly just one champ or a couple champs abusing it but thats just imo
realized and realised are both corerct depending on your nationality, so as they are both considered correct on this forum. as this place is for people from eu and na.

Honestly devouror has become a problem because people realized they can build it and {{item:3748}} and dump on games well building massive hp and resists. Usually a champ that buys rageblade is still squishy.

Guinsoo's is not the problem. Sated was the problem because it's too difficult to itemize against and you only needed one companion damage item (Guinsoo's, BotRK, Titanic Hydra w/Sterak's) to make you deal not only ridiculous damage, but allow you to transition into a tanky assassin that can't be dealt with as typically as an assassin should be.
I remember facing a xin who didn't even upgrade his jungle item and destroyed with just guinsoos and hunters machete.
